channel.title: Computational Mechanics of Soft Materials Lab (CMSML)

item.title: EMI 2025: Talk on size effects in soft materials
item.dc:creator: Berkin Dortdivanlioglu
item.description: Gave a talk on “Size-Dependent Instabilities in Highly Deformable Strain-Gradient Materials” at EMI 2025 in Anaheim, CA. Credit goes to the PhD student Jun for his work on this topic.

item.title: Berkin is elected as the new editor of the newsletter for the ASME technical committee of Mechanics of Soft Materials
item.dc:creator: bd24583
item.description: Berkin has been elected as the new editor of the ASME (Applied Mechanics Division) Technical Committee on Mechanics of Soft Materials. According to the policy, he will continue to serve the committee as secretary, then as vice chair, and finally as chair over the next four years.

item.title: We recieved the NSF CAREER Award!
item.dc:creator: bd24583
item.description: National Science Foundation (NSF) CAREER Award on CAREER: Multiscale Mechanics of Highly Deformable Strain-Gradient Electric Generators

item.title: Ashkan Received the Kolodzey Travel Award
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan received the Kolodzey Travel Award from the CAEE department at UT Austin, which allowed him to attend the MPM Workshop in Berkeley, CA, where he presented his research on Mechanics of Polymeric Porous Membranes using a Stabilized Extended B-Spline Material Point Method.

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi Presents at the 15th Annual MPM Workshop
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan attended the 15th Annual MPM Workshop at the University of California, Berkeley, held from September 5-6, 2024. He gave a presentation titled Mechanics of Porous Polymeric Membranes Using Stabilized Extended B-spline Material Point Method. Well done, Ashkan!

item.title: Congratulations to Our Lab's Ph.D. Students on Receiving the George J. Heuer, Jr. Ph.D. Endowed Fellowship
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Three of our lab’s Ph.D. students—Ashkan Ali Madadi, Ekim Ekiz, and Jun Wang—have been awarded the George J. Heuer, Jr. Ph.D. Endowed Fellowship from the Cockrell School of Engineering for the 2024-2025 academic year. This fellowship recognizes and supports their outstanding research and contributions in their fields.

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi Presents at the Engineering Mechanics Institute Conference 2024
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan Ali Madadi, a Ph.D. student in our lab, presented his research titled “Stabilized Extended B-Spline Material Point Method for Multi-Field Soft Materials with Nitsche Imposition of Boundary Conditions” at the Engineering Mechanics Institute Conference (EMI 2024). The conference was held in Chicago from May 28 to 31. Congratulations to...

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi and Ekim Ekiz Present Collaborative Research at the Fracture of Soft Materials Symposium
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan Ali Madadi and Ekim Ekiz, Ph.D. students in our lab, presented their collaborative research titled “Modeling Nearly Incompressible Behavior in Soft Solids Using the Material Point Method” at the Fracture of Soft Materials Symposium, held in Austin from May 12 to 16, 2024. Their work, co-authored with Richard Noh,...

item.title: Prof. Berkin Receives CAEE's 2024 Faculty Teaching Award
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Prof. Berkin is the 2024 recipient of CAEE’s Faculty Teaching Award! He was nominated by CAEE students, and selected by a committee of previous award recipients. Congratulations to Prof. Berkin!

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi Presents at the American Physical Society March Meeting 2024
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan Ali Madadi, a Ph.D. student in our lab, presented his research titled “Diffusion-Induced Swelling of Shape Morphing Hydrogels” at the American Physical Society (APS) March Meeting 2024. The conference took place in Minneapolis from March 3 to 8. Congratulations to Ashkan!

item.title: End-of-Year Gathering 2023!
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: (left to right) Zahra, Ashkan, Ekim, Derya, BD, Rirchard, Dat Le, Jun, Seda

item.title: Our group attends the 2023 SES Conference in Minneapolis
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Minneapolis, October 8-11, 2023 PhD students, Ashkan, Derya, Jun, and Ekim, participated in the 2023 Society of Engineering Science Annual Technical Meeting in Minneapolis. Ashkan presented on “a subdivision-stabilized isogeometric material point method for strongly coupled diffusion in hydrogels, a new Eulerian-Lagrangian formulation for highly deformable materials with diffusion. Ashkan...

item.title: CAEE Department Naming Event
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Fariborz Maseeh Department of Civil, Architectural, and Environmental Engineering

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi and Dr. Berkin Dortdivanlioglu attended the 17th USNCCM conference
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan Madadi and Dr. Berkin Dortdivanlioglu presented their research at the 17th U.S. National Congress on Computational Mechanics (USNCCM) held in Albuquerque, New Mexico. At the conference, Ashkan made a presentation titled “Stabilized Material Point Method for Self-Contacting Porous Hydrogels.” and Dr. Dortdivanlioglu talked about modeling viscoelasto-capillary deformations in soft...

item.title: Ashkan Ali Madadi and Dr. Berkin Dortdivanlioglu attended the EMI2023 conference
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Ashkan and Dr. Dortdivanlioglu attended the Engineering Mechanics Institute Conference (EMI) held in Atlanta, Georgia in June 2023. Ashkan presented his work on “Bspline Material Point Method for Strongly Coupled Poroelastic Materials,” and Dr. Dortdivanlioglu talked about modeling adhesive and capillary forces in soft materials.

item.title: Richard Noh Awarded Prestigious Dr. Marco Antonio Zuniga Izaguirre Endowed Scholarship
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description:
Richard Noh has been selected as the recipient of the prestigious Dr. Marco Antonio Zuniga Izaguirre Endowed Scholarship in Engineering and Physics.
Congrats, Richard on this well-deserved recognition!

item.title: Richard Noh has been awarded the 2023 Ivo & Renata Babuska Scholarship in CSE
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Richard Noh has been awarded the 2023 Ivo & Renata Babuska Scholarship in Computational Science and Engineering. This award was established to recognize and support the studies of exceptional senior-level undergraduate students at the university who are undertaking research at the Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences.

item.title: Derya won the best presentation in the 4th CAEE Graduate Symposium
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Derya received the first-place prize for best presentation in the 4th CAEE Graduate Symposium held at UT Austin on March 24, with her presentation on modeling the adhesive interfaces between soft materials.

item.title: Derya presented her work at the APS March Meeting 2023
item.dc:creator: jw55692
item.description: Derya presented her work on the numerical modeling of the elasto-adhesive behavior of soft materials at the APS March Meeting 2023 in Las Vegas. Derya attended the meeting with funds from the DSOFT Future Investigator Conference Travel Award and the UT Professional Development Award.

item.title: Animesh won the best poster award at IMECE 2022!
item.dc:creator: bd24583
item.description: Congratulations Animesh for winning the BEST poster award in Computing in Applied Mechanics! (IMECE2022) Huge congratulations to my graduate student @AnimeshRastog20 from @ut_caee for winning the BEST poster award in Computing in Applied Mechanics at IMECE 2022! @ut_caee @UTAustin @OdenInstitute @ASMEdotorg @MembraneLab #IMECE2022 pic.twitter.com/8djW1Mn9rd – Berkin Dortdivanlioglu (@brkn4) November 2,...
